summary: Enable the TypeScript SDK gRPC client to work in web browsers by leveraging gRPC-Web, with a client package free of non-proto core dependencies. This requires both client-side support and server-side infrastructure (proxy or HTTP/1.1 API).
userImpact: Users can run the Temporal TypeScript SDK client in browser environments for web-based workflow interactions.
proposedFix: Leverage gRPC-Web library and implement server-side proxy support (Envoy or built-in) or develop HTTP/1.1 API backend compatibility
workaround: Use Envoy proxy or grpc-web proxy sidecar to translate browser requests to gRPC for server
keyQuote: We're working on an HTTP/1.1 API that can be used to back running the TS SDK client in a browser.
